Curriculum Vitae 
                 
Sibo de Jong, Dutch, Married, 3 teenage children  
Partner is elected city counsel member of the Hague   Current position:   
 
Vice president pharmaceutical development since 2002, Leiderdorp, 
NL 
 
PDD (Pharmaceutical Development Department ) has 60 employees and an annual 
budget of 27 million euro. 50 % of the employees is academic (12 PhD members) and about 15 % not native Dutch. The language in all documents and meetings is US English. Core task of the department is  the CTM (Clinical Trail Materials = Human 
test medicines) supply for about 40 % of all corporate clinical trails. An additional 
main task is formulation development for early phase CTM. Took the initiative to accelerate the corporate early phase CMC development from 14 to 6 months.Q Curriculum Vitae 
                 
Sibo de Jong, Dutch, Married, 3 teenage children  
Partner is elected city counsel member of the Hague   Current position:   
 
Vice president pharmaceutical development since 2002, Leiderdorp, 
NL 
 
PDD (Pharmaceutical Development Department ) has 60 employees and an annual 
budget of 27 million euro. 50 % of the employees is academic (12 PhD members) and about 15 % not native Dutch. The language in all documents and meetings is US English. Core task of the department is  the CTM (Clinical Trail Materials = Human 
test medicines) supply for about 40 % of all corporate clinical trails. An additional 
main task is formulation development for early phase CTM. Took the initiative to accelerate the corporate early phase CMC development from 14 to 6 months.QA release and CMC writing is included in the PDD respon sibilities. The department 
includes labs and manufacturing facilities for CTM. At the moment the department is 
involved in about 50 product development projects in 8 therapeutic area’s. On average 2-3 new products are launched in EU ever y year. The department has very intense 
direct relations with Japanese laboratories . Staff exchange both ways between these 
sites is done on regular basis. In 2012 the department will move to newly constructed 
labs in Leiden, NL.  Previous:   
 
Section head PDD technology, Yamanouchi, Meppel, NL 1998-2001  
 Started with reconstruction and new equipments for semi industrial oral solids 
manufacturing in the pilot plant. In this period responsible for the process and 
industrial development of Tocas and Vesicare  ( each now blockbuster). Led the process 
development and purchase of equipment for industrial manufacturing lines. The investments led to an increase of the volume  from 25 to 75 million packs a year and 
from 120 to 300 manufacturing staff. A dditionally registrated as EMA-QP for 
Yamanouchi (a predecessor of Astellas) CTM.    

 
Head technical services MSD (Merck) Haarlem, NL 1993-1998 
 
In this period responsible for : Introduction and manufacturing launch of all new products from technology point of view , Interface between MR L (Merck R&D) and 
MMD (Merck manufacturing). Production pharmacist for aseptic manufacturing lines 
with blow fill seal machines, semi solid, tablet manufacturing and liquids. Additional 
project manager for closing the fungicide and feed mix plants and transfer these to a Novartis manufacturing site. Later also tr ansferred the insecticid es manufacturing to 
Novartis. Broad experience wo rking with FDA ( 3 inspections of aseptic plant, no 483) 
and the USA based research labs and chemical and fermentation plants. Budget 
responsibility $ 40 million. 
 
Head production & development Altana Zwanenburg, NL 1986-1992 
 
Technical site manager for a manufacturing facility of controlled release beads for capsules (SDF (Solid Dispersible Forms)). Separately conducted formulation development and manufacturing of CTM for new modified release drugs, in this 
period 4 publications and one Patent app lication (US and EU). Project manager of 
investment plan (completed 1992) to double the site capacity including 3 new spray coating towers, and 4 new coating pan’s and a 25.000 cubic meter/hr air volume organic solvent incineration plant. Responsible for 25-30 staff members. 
  
 
Education: Pharmacist degree Groningen state University 1987, 
Masters Degree in pharmaceutical technology in 1985 
Experiences: Broad experiences in 0perational management of 
pharmaceutical development,  CTM supply, technology 
transfer & manufacturing, in cluding injectable and large 
scale insecticides and fungicides 
Has good leadership skills an d demonstrated capability to 
manage departments in professional multinational environment. Motivate s people by removing  fear for failure. 
Has strategic insight in drug development and corporate 
development 。Started learning Japanese. 
Style: All round professional department manager. Management 
by walking around and extensive networking. Is enthusiastic but sometimes impatient. Has a high loyalty to 
the company and is not afraid of giving in the size and scope 
of the own department for

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
